data.text:
Sun Belt

Women's Basketball 8/8/2024 11:01:00 AM

Sun Belt Announces the 2024-25 Women’s Basketball Conference Schedule

The Chanticleers will play 18 conference events

NEW ORLEANS – The Sun Belt Conference released its 2024-25 women's basketball conference schedule on Thursday, which consists of an 18-game conference slate with nine games at home and nine games coming on the road.

Member schools will play each team within their division twice (home and away), with six games against opponents in the other division.

All conference games will be streamed live on ESPN+.

Sun Belt Conference play will tip-off on Dec. 29, as the Chanticleers will open at home versus West Division foe ULM.

The Chants will kick off the 2025 calendar year with a four-game road trip. CCU will open its road portion of the conference schedule at Troy (Jan. 2) and South Alabama (Jan. 4) before traveling to Old Dominion (Jan. 8) and App State (Jan. 11) the following weekend.

Coastal will return to the HTC Center with back-to-back contests against divisional foes Georgia State (Jan. 16) and James Madison (Jan. 18), before visiting to Atlanta for matchups with the Panthers (Jan. 22) and Dukes (Jan. 25). The Chants will close out the month of January by hosting Marshall (Jan. 29) and welcome Louisiana (Feb. 1) to start February.

The Chanticleers take to the road for back-to-back mid-week contests at Texas State (Feb. 5) and Georgia Southern (Feb. 12), then head to West Virginia to take on Marshall (Feb. 15).

Coastal will return home for a four-game stretch with Georgia Southern (Feb. 19), Arkansas State (Feb. 122), Old Dominion (Feb. 26), and Appalachian State (Feb. 28) to wrap up the 2024-25 regular-season conference slate.

The regular season will conclude with all 14 schools playing in the 2025 Sun Belt Women's Basketball Championship from March 4-10, 2025, at the Pensacola Bay Center in Pensacola, Fla.

For complete coverage of CCU women's basketball, follow the Chants on social media @CoastalWBB (Twitter), facebook.com/CCUChanticleers (Facebook), @GoCCUSports (Instagram), or visit the official home of Coastal Carolina Athletics at www.GoCCUsports.com.
